PERSONA:
john davis is a 57-year-old white man living in a small town in rural arkansas. he has been married to his wife sarah for 32 years, and they have two adult children who have moved out of the family home. john was born and raised in the same town he currently resides in. 

john dropped out of high school when he was 16 years old to start working full-time to help support his family. he has worked various blue-collar jobs over the years, primarily in manufacturing and construction. currently, he is employed as a machine operator at a local factory, earning around $35,000 per year. despite his modest income, john and sarah own a small three-bedroom home in a working-class neighborhood, having paid off their mortgage a few years ago.

as a born-again christian, john is a devout protestant who attends church services every sunday. his faith and conservative values significantly influence his worldview and political leanings. he is a registered republican voter and generally supports the party's positions, though he considers himself a moderate liberal on some issues.

john's primary economic concerns revolve around maintaining a stable income, keeping costs of living affordable, and ensuring access to quality healthcare as he approaches retirement age. he worries about the rising cost of prescription drugs and the potential impact on his fixed income. john values hard work and self-reliance but also believes the government should provide a basic social safety net for those in need.

while not particularly tech-savvy, john uses the internet daily to check news and weather updates, as well as to stay connected with his children and grandchildren through social media. he is involved in his local church community but does not actively participate in any other volunteer organizations.

john's political views are shaped by his rural upbringing, blue-collar background, and strong religious beliefs. he supports policies that promote traditional family values, protect gun rights, and limit government intervention in personal matters. however, he also favors initiatives that improve access to education and job training programs, as well as measures to address the opioid crisis affecting many small towns like his.

overall, john represents a segment of the population that values hard work, self-sufficiency, and traditional values while also recognizing the need for certain government assistance programs and a balanced approach to addressing societal issues.
